conclusion: Determine the electric field at point A using superposition principle.
Charge 2q is at one vertex of the cube.
Charge -q is at an adjacent vertex of the cube.
Midpoint O is along the diagonal of the face of the cube.
Distance between charges 2q and -q is L.
Electric field due to charge 2q at O is k * 8q / L^2.
Electric field due to charge -q at O is k * -4q / L^2.
Total electric field at O is k * 4q / L^2.
Distance from charge 2q to point A is L.
Distance from charge -q to point A is L.
Electric field due to charge 2q at A is k * 2q / L^2.
Electric field due to charge -q at A is k * -q / L^2.
Total electric field at A is k * q / L^2.
Electric field at A is 1/4 of the electric field at O.
